key_points: First Lady Dr. Jill Biden wore an upcycled, navy version of her white inauguration dress to President Biden's first address to Congress.
The dress, designed by Gabriela Hearst, featured federal flowers from every state and territory, including the District of Columbia.
Designer Gabriela Hearst expressed honor over Dr. Biden's choice and emphasized the sustainability of the outfit.
Vice President Kamala Harris wore a cream-colored Prabal Gurung suit and satin camisole, symbolizing a choice of 'light over darkness.'
Designer Prabal Gurung, an immigrant from Nepal, highlighted the significance of Harris wearing his design and spoke about the importance of representation.
Harris also wore a Prabal Gurung outfit for her first day in office at the Inaugural prayer service.
President Biden's speech was notable for having two women, Nancy Pelosi and Kamala Harris, flanked on the dais for the first time.
Nancy Pelosi expressed excitement about making history with women's representation during the event.
Democratic women in Congress emphasized the importance of the women seated behind Biden during his speech.
Vice President Harris is celebrated as the first woman, first Black person, and first person of Asian descent to hold the office.
